pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:0.5_0: The training rule on defecating on cultivated plants
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.11_0: if he does it in a place with no cultivated plants, but it then spreads to cultivated plants;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.15_0: The fourteenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting on cultivated plants. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.3.1_0: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.4_0: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.5_0: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits on cultivated plants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
